segments.en: Linked Discourses 20
1. Similes
8. Wood Blocks
So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Vesālī, at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.
There the Buddha addressed the mendicants,
“Mendicants!”
“Venerable sir,” they replied.
The Buddha said this:

segments.pli: “Kaliṅgarūpadhānā, bhikkhave, etarahi licchavī viharanti appamattā ātāpino upāsanasmiṃ.
segments.en: “Mendicants, these days the Licchavis live using wood blocks as pillows, and they exercise diligently and keenly.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto na labhati otāraṃ na labhati ārammaṇaṃ.
segments.en: King Ajātasattu Vedehiputta of Magadha finds no vulnerability, he’s got no foothold.

segments.pli: Bhavissanti, bhikkhave, anāgatamaddhānaṃ licchavī sukhumālā mudutalunahatthapādā
segments.en: But in the future the Licchavis will become delicate, with soft and tender hands and feet.

segments.pli: te mudukāsu seyyāsu tūlabibbohanāsu yāvasūriyuggamanā seyyaṃ kappissanti.
segments.en: They’ll sleep on soft beds with down pillows until the sun comes up.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto lacchati otāraṃ lacchati ārammaṇaṃ.
segments.en: King Ajātasattu Vedehiputta of Magadha will find a vulnerability, he’ll get his foothold.

segments.pli: Kaliṅgarūpadhānā, bhikkhave, etarahi bhikkhū viharanti appamattā ātāpino padhānasmiṃ.
segments.en: These days the mendicants live using wood blocks as pillows, and they meditate diligently and keenly.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ māro pāpimā na labhati otāraṃ na labhati ārammaṇaṃ.
segments.en: Māra the Wicked finds no vulnerability, he's got no foothold.

segments.pli: Bhavissanti, bhikkhave, anāgatamaddhānaṃ bhikkhū sukhumā mudutalunahatthapādā.
segments.en: But in the future the mendicants will become delicate, with soft and tender hands and feet.

segments.pli: Te mudukāsu seyyāsu tūlabibbohanāsu yāvasūriyuggamanā seyyaṃ kappissanti.
segments.en: They’ll sleep on soft beds with down pillows until the sun comes up.

segments.pli: Tesaṃ māro pāpimā lacchati otāraṃ lacchati ārammaṇaṃ.
segments.en: Māra the Wicked will find a vulnerability and will get a foothold.
So you should train like this:
‘We will live using wood blocks as pillows, and we will meditate diligently and keenly.’
That’s how you should train.”

suttaplex.blurb: Warriors who sleep on wooden pillows remain vigilant, and so it is for the spiritual seeker.
